api_arguments.blockID: string (Identifier for a block. Also accepts a page ID.)
api_arguments.children: list (Child content to append to a container block as an array of block objects.)
api_arguments.after: string (The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.)

functionality: Creates and appends new children blocks to the parent block_id specified.
questions: I want to add a bolded paragraph on the importance of recycling in my paper.

functionality: Retrieves a Block object using the ID specified.
questions: I want to retrieve my to-do checklist under today's date.

api_arguments.startCursor: string (Page of results starts after the cursor provided)
api_arguments.pageSize: int32 (The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100)

functionality: Returns a paginated array of child block objects contained in the block using the ID specified.
questions: I want to retrieve all the fruit in my grocery shopping list.

api_arguments.updatedBlock: block (Block that will replace old block)
api_arguments.archive: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

functionality: Updates the content for the specified block_id based on the block type. Supported fields based on the block object type.
questions: I want to update my plans for today to include more self care.

functionality: Sets a Block object, including page blocks, to archived: true using the ID specified.
questions: Some of the notes are outdated and they should be deleted.

api_arguments.parent: json (the parent page or database where the new page is inserted)
api_arguments.properties: json (The values of the page’s properties.)
api_arguments.children: array of strings (The content to be rendered on the new Page.)
api_arguments.icon: json (The icon of the new page. Either an emoji object or an external file object.)
api_arguments.cover: json (The cover image of the new page.)

functionality: Creates a new page that is a child of an existing page or database.
questions: There should be a page on the rules for Capture the Flag in the game book for field day.

functionality: Retrieves a Page object (page properties) using the ID specified.
questions: Select the list of groceries for tomorrow.

api_name: Notion - Retrieve a page property item

api_arguments.pageSize: int32 (For paginated properties. The max number of property item objects on a page. The default size is 100)

functionality: Retrieves a property_item object for a given page_id and property_id.
questions: I want a list of titles for all the stories in the database about Fairytales.

api_arguments.pageID: string (The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.)
api_arguments.properties: json (The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values.)
api_arguments.archived: boolean (Whether the page is archived (deleted). Set to true to archive a page. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a page.)
api_arguments.icon: json (A page icon for the page.)
api_arguments.cover: json (A cover image for the page. Only external file objects are supported.)

functionality: Updates the properties of a page in a database.
questions: I want to retitle my notes for tomorrow's meeting.

api_arguments.title: array (Title of database as it appears in Notion.)

functionality: Creates a database as a subpage in the specified parent page, with the specified properties schema.
questions: I want to keep track of all the fun events that were put on last year with attendance, budget, and ratings.

api_arguments.databaseID: string (The name of the property as it appears in the database or propertyID)
api_arguments.filter: object (The type-specific filter condition for the query.)

functionality: On a database query, limits the returned entries based on the specified criteria.
questions: I only want to look at projects due before 2025

api_arguments.databaseID: string (The name of the property as it appears in the database or propertyID)

functionality: A sort is a condition used to order the entries returned from a database query.
questions: I want to read all the information on the attendees of the events from year in alphabetical order.

api_arguments.databaseID: string (The name of the property as it appears in the database or propertyID)
api_arguments.filterProperties: array of strings (A list of page property value IDs associated with the database.)

functionality: Gets a list of Pages and/or Databases contained in the database, filtered and ordered according to the filter conditions and sort criteria provided in the request.
questions: I want to find all the items in the store that have a stock greater than 30 items.

api_arguments.databaseID: string (The name of the property as it appears in the database or propertyID)

functionality: Retrieves a database object — information that describes the structure and columns of a database — for a provided database ID.
questions: I want to know what information the database on our inventory stores.

api_arguments.title: array (An array of rich text objects that represents the title of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI.)
api_arguments.description: array (An array of rich text objects that represents the description of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI.)
api_arguments.properties: json (The properties of a database to be changed in the request in the form of a JSON object.

functionality: Updates the database object — the title, description, or properties — of a specified database.
questions: I want to change the documented creator of the inventory database
